attributes.action: Reduce the Birmingham Clean Air penalty charge and daily charge rate by 50%.
attributes.additional_details: Cost of living is rising with no reprieve. In order to elevate the pressure on drivers and businesses that need to access the Birmingham Clean Air Zone, a cut to these charges is almost certainly needed. By a minimum of 50%.
attributes.background: We want parliament to reduce the charge for both penalties and daily rate charge by a minimum of 50%. Offsetting the already extortionate fuel costs. This not only affects personal vehicles but commercial vehicles. Increasing costs for services and products.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of Birmingham City council.
	
You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition Birmingham City Council - you can find out more here: https://www.birmingham.gov.uk/info/20146/consultation_and_engagement/702/petitions

You could start a new petition asking for the UK Government and Parliament to make a change to the national framework for clean air zones, if there's a specific change that you'd like to see.
